Music Reviews

Festivals 2016: Dot to Dot Manchester - Day Review

"Is there a bar around here?" "No mate, this is a church."

Single Review: The Stone Roses - All For One

The Stone Roses first release for 21 years may not be perfect, but indicates promising things for the future, writes Ben Reid

Album Review: Radiohead - A Moon Shaped Pool

Radiohead's electronic-infused ninth album demonstrates that the alt-rockers remain as interesting as ever, says Henry Brown

Album Review: Beyonce - LEMONADE

Liz Alexianu breaks down one of the most talked-about and controversial releases of the year

End of a purple reign

By Jonathan Wellington

As music icon Prince passes away aged 57, Jack Davies looks back at His Royal Purpleness' glittering career

Benjamin Francis Leftwich: "I love the music that comes out of York"

Leftwich talks touring, the effects of fame and the York music scene before his sold-out hometown show.

Live Review: Benjamin Francis Leftwich @ The Crescent, York 01/05/16

The York-born artist delivered an utterly enthralling and intimate evening for his home town show

Live Review: Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds @ First Direct Arena, Leeds 27/04/2016

Noel Gallagher's solo project continues to offer astounding live performances to ever-enthusiastic crowds, mixing impressive solo tracks with euphoric, much-loved Oasis tunes

Festivals 2016: Down To The Woods - Preview

Down To The Woods, a brand-new festival in County Durham, offers a fantastic festival experience for a knock-down price

Festivals 2016: T in the Park - Preview

T in the Park boasts something for fans of absolutely anything in 2016, with a knockout set of headliners to boot

Live Review: Troye Sivan @ Manchester Academy 19/04/16

Liz Alexianu reviews a rare UK gig from the Australian Youtube sensation

Album Review: Macklemore & Ryan Lewis - This Unruly Mess I've Made

The pair tackle white privilege, the Kenrick Lamar snub and the #BlackLivesMatter movement in their latest album.

Album Review: Iggy Pop - Post Pop Depression

Post Pop Depression is an that album deals with Iggy Pop's legacy, both musical and personal, writes Aaron Spiers.

Album Review: Eliza And The Bear - Eliza And The Bear

This collection of old and new tracks is 2016's go-to summer album, writes Liz Alexianu.

Album Review: Everything You've Come to Expect - The Last Shadow Puppets

After an eight year break from their beloved side project, Alex Turner and Miles Kane return to the music scene as The Last Shadow Puppets once again.

Album Review: Birdy - Beautiful Lies

Despite this album's depth and clarity Birdy's music still lacks variety, writes Eleanor Langford.

Live Review: Grimes @ Rock City, Nottingham 08/03/2016

On stage at Nottingham's Rock City Grimes sustains an atmosphere that is equally electrifying on stage as it is on the floor.

Album Review: Kanye West - The Life Of Pablo

Antonio Pinheiro weighs in on Kanye's highly anticipated new album

Live Review: Foals @ Manchester Arena

Foals tentatively re-invent themselves as a staple of the arena-rock circuit

Live Review: Will Varley @ Brudenell Social Club, Leeds 18/02/16

Chris Owen reviews as the quick-witted and quietly brilliant Varley takes to the road with his latest headline tour

Live Review: Eliza and the Bear @ The Duchess, York 15/02/16

Eliza and the Bear delivered a flawless five-star performance to the warm Duchess crowd, write Martha Wright.

Live Review: Bloc Party @ Leeds Academy

Bloc Party's hit-packed NME Awards Tour show demonstrated they still have something to say - even if the new material doesn't

Album Review: Coldplay - A Head Full Of Dreams

Coldplay freshen things with high profile collaborations and some funky, energetic tunes.

Album Review: Bury Tomorrow - Earthbound

Into The Archives: Machine Head - Burn My Eyes

Rediscover one of the best and most-imitated albums of the 1990s

Live Review: Little Comets & Hippo Campus @ The Wardrobe, Leeds

Little Comets tear up Leeds Wardrobe, joined by up-and-coming rockers Hippo Campus, who "sing of how they couldn't give less of a shit when, in performance, they clearly do."

Live Review: Adam French @ The Basement, York 26/01/16

On the final leg of his first UK tour French brought calm and tonality to the intimate evening setting, writes Liam Dooley.

Live Review: Daughter @ The Albert Hall, Manchester 21/01/16

Munisha Lall finds fulfilment in the hypnotism of Daughter's latest tour

Album Review: Mystery Jets - Curve of the Earth

Muse Editor gives his verdict on a space-aged Mystery Jets album lacking a sucker-punch

Album Review: Panic! At The Disco - Death of a Bachelor

Liam Dooley raves about Panic! At The Disco's somewhat unusual fifth album
